Direct Link:┬аhttps://youtu.be/lwZbmHGBKRA┬а

URL for the webcast is:┬аhttps://webcast.gov.in/moe┬а
Date:┬а25th┬аAugust 2022
Time:┬а9.00 AM
NOTE:┬аWe are going to witness the biggest edition of Smart India Hackathon 2022 grand finale ever. This year the decentralized concept of campus-level hackathon was introduced. Close to 30,000 teams registered for the SIH 2022, out of which more than 2000 teams were selected for the SIH 2022 grand finale at national level. This year more than 15000 students and mentors are traveling to the 75 nodal centers to take part in the SIH 2020 grand finale. Smart India Hackathon 2022 hardware grand finale is scheduled from 25th┬аAugust to 29th┬аAugust 2022 and the Smart India Hackathon 2022 software grand finale is scheduled from 25th┬аaugust to 26th┬аAugust 2022.
Regards,

*About Datasolve*: 
DataSolve gives you the chance to work with engineers and data scientists to share insights and better understand real-world opportunities available to you in the field of data science. The two-week hackathon-style competition is an annual event conducted across multiple geographies with the goal of connecting you to Wolters Kluwer executives through your shared ideas, experiences and passion for using data to solve real-world challenges.

11/2/22, 17:24 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear Mr. Sameer katekar,



Greetings from Economic Times Digital! 

 

We are pleased to inform you that the registrations for the sixth edition of ET Campus Stars (ETCS 6.0) are now open and we would like to invite students from your institute to register for IndiaтАЩs largest platform that identifies and rewards the best engineering talent in the country. 



Launched in 2017, this flagship initiative of the Economic Times Digital has attracted over 2 lakh engineering students from 2000+ engineering colleges across the country. The 5th edition of the ETCS programme saw participation from over 52,000 students, of which 91 students made it to the coveted lists of тАШET Campus StarsтАЩ and were felicitated by the Economic Times 



About ET Campus Stars 6.0

A four phase assessment programme, ETCS is open to engineering students studying in the 3rd or 4th year of an undergraduate engineering course from any of the AICTE approved colleges. This year, the programme has EIT InnoEnergy as the sustainable energy partner, Think Exam as assessment partner, Study24x7 as learning partner, and Bennett University as Knowledge Partner. 



ETCS 6.0 Program Phases:

Phase 1: Aptitude, personality and cognitive behaviour assessment.

Phase 2: Domain Knowledge Assessment

Phase 3: Assessment of group dynamics and leadership

Phase 4: Meet the Jury



Each phase would be followed by a shortlisting process. Students shortlisted for Phase 4 will be interviewed and evaluated by one of our eminent jury members. The jury members for ETCS 6.0 include top leaders from India Inc. like Ashwin Damera, CEO, Eruditus & Emeritus; Prof. Dr. Frank Gielen, Executive Board Member And Education Director, EIT InnoEnergy; Dale Vaz, Chief Technology Officer, Swiggy; Kailash Nadh, CTO, Zerodha, Lalit Singh, Managing Director, McGraw Hill; Santhosh Kumar, MD, Texas Instruments; Shailendra Katyal, Managing Director, Lenovo India P Ltd; and, Shreyasi Singh, Founder & CEO, Harappa Education, among others.



To know more about the program phases and registration process, please visit www.etcampusstars.com

 

Why participate in ETCS?

ETCS is not only the largest but also the most intensive program to identify the best engineering talent. Acknowledged as a тАШlife-changingтАЩ experience by the past participants of the program, ETCS offers the following gratifications to students:

Self-discovery of core strengths/ limitations on a globally-validated and industry-endorsed process

Opportunity to benchmark oneself against other engineering students across the country

Inspiring and enriching exclusive interaction with leaders of repute of India Inc- once in a life-time opportunity!

A chance to be featured in The Economic Times and gain nation-wide recognition

Opportunity to jump-start the career early-on

 

How to participate?

To participate, you have to register on www.etcampusstars.com and complete the Phase 1 Assessment at the earliest.



 We request you to share this email with the students of your esteemed college and encourage them to participate in the program which will prove to be a milestone in their academic journey. 

 

Looking forward to an enthusiastic response from your institute. Please feel free to reach out to us in case of any query.

11/5/22, 16:50 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear Sir/Madam,
Greetings from AICTE..

National-Level Mockathon (skill2030.com ) is an initiative to provide a virtual opportunity to all job aspiring students where they can plan and practice for a job interview. Interviewing skills are one of the critical qualifiers in Job selection process.

Importance of Interviewing Skill

Interviewing skills give an interviewer insight into how a candidate communicates in the workplace and solves problems. Interviewing skills include verbal communication, Time Management, Confidence, Active Listening, and naturally, Domain Knowledge. It is a brief opportunity to convey valuable information about his/her education, abilities and experience to the potential employer. Studies show that 69.1% of candidates fail job interviews due to weak interview skills.

About skill2030.com: Enligence Technology Labs (creator of skill2030.com) is working towards making the overall process of skilling and recruitment stress-free. Skill2030.com is an AI-Powered Metaverse Avatar-conducted Communication skills training and Job Interview Automation Platform. 

Why Participate in the Mockathon?

Metaverse job interviews may become the norm in the future. This platform is a unique preparation ground with

AI Evaluation: State-of-the-art AI technology offers multiple interview evaluation metrics
Metaverse Interviewer: Multiple Male/Female Interviewer Avatars of Indian, American, and British English Accent
Stress-Free: Helps you to reduce your stress and anxiety about interviewing!
Have Fun: It is a practice simulation of an actual job interview. Great Fun Learning!
Leaderboard: Individual and College-wise leaderboards.
Mockathon Date: 11-11-2022
Last Date for Registration: 09-11-2022
Registration Page: https://mockathon.skill2030.com/
Flyer Print Version: https://bit.ly/mockathon (small version is attached)
No Registration Fee

Notes: Login Instructions will be sent to the registered email. Smartphone or Laptop with the internet is sufficient for the skill2030 Mockathon.

In this connection, it is requested to encourage your students to participate in the event. For any queries contact us by writing to admin@skill2030.com.

Ingenium Campus Ambassadors Program (ICAP)
For young professionals seeking an opportunity to grow their leadership skills, the Ingenium Campus Ambassadors Program (ICAP) is an opportunity for you to showcase your managerial and interpersonal skills. ICAP ambassadors act as location specific brand ambassadors for Quest Global Ingenium. Candidates with a creative instinct, good communication skills (English/Regional languages), and a passion for networking can encourage their peers for participation in Quest Global Ingenium.

IIJ Research Laboratory conducts advanced research and technology development on the Internet. The researchers, strongly collaborating with the WIDE Project, were long involved in IPv6 standardization and its BSD stack implementation (KAME project), published well known national Internet traffic measurements and analysis for the last years (MAWI project), endeavored to establish a securer interdomain routing protocol, and to experiment with ecological data centers as well as cloud services.

We are looking for motivated interns who can work with us to accelerate our projects by researching problems, proposing solutions, implementing tools, making various simulations, and so on. рд░реЛрдЬ рдЭреЛрдкрддрд╛рдирд╛ рдкрд╛рдпрд╛рдкрд╛рд╢реА рдмрд╕рдгрд╛рд░реНрдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╕рдХрд╛рд│реА рдЙрдареВрди рдЫрд╛рддрд╛рдбрд╛рд╡рд░ рдирд╛рдЪрдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдХрдЯрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╕рд╣рдкреНрд░рд╡рд╛рд╕реА рдорд╛рдиреВрди рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдорд╡реЗрдд рдЕрдЦрдВрдб рд╕рдВрдШрд░реНрд╖рд╛рдЪреА рдЬреАрд╡рди рдпрд╛рддреНрд░рд╛ рджрд┐рдорд╛рдЦрд╛рдиреЗ рдЬрдЧрдгрд╛рд░реНрдпрд╛ рдПрдо . рдПрди . рдирд╡рд▓реЗ рдирд╛рд╡рд╛рдЪреА рд╣реА рдПрдХ рджрдВрдд рдХрдерд╛ рдирд╛рд╣реА рддрд░ рдЧреБрдв рдХрдерд╛ рдЖрд╣реЗ !  рдорд╛рдбрдЧреВрд│рдХрд░рд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдХрд╡рд┐рддреЗрддреАрд▓ ' рддреЛ рд░рд╛рдЬрд╣рдВрд╕ ' рд╣рд╛ рдПрдХрдЪ рд╣реЛрддрд╛ , рддрд╕рд╛ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдг рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╣реНрдпрд╛рджреНрд░реАрд╡рд░ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдбрдЪреЗ рд▓реЗрдгреЗ рдХреЛрд░рдгрд╛рд░рд╛ рд╣рд╛  рд░рд╛рдЬрд╣рдВрд╕ рджреЗрдЦреАрд▓ рдПрдХрдореЗрд╡ рдирд╡реНрд╣реЗ рддрд░ рдПрдХрдореЗрд╡рд╛рджреНрд╡рд┐рддреАрдп рдЖрд╣реЗ ! 

рднрд╛рдХрд░реАрдЪрд╛ рдЪрдВрджреНрд░ рд╢реЛрдзрдгреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдареА рдкреБрдгреНрдпрд╛рдд рдпреЗрдКрди рдорд╛рд╕реНрддрд░рдХреА рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░рд╛ рдПрдХ рдирд╡рдпреБрд╡рдХ рджрд╢рдХрднрд░рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЕрдкрд╛рд░ рдореЗрд╣рдирддреАрдиреЗ рдЖрднрд╛рд│рд╛рдПрд╡рдвреЗ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдгрд╕рд╛рдореНрд░рд╛рдЬреНрдЮ рдирд┐рд░реНрдорд╛рдг рдХрд░реВ рд╢рдХрддреЛ , рд╣реА рджрдВрддрдХрдерд╛ рдХреЗрд╡рд│ рддреЗрдЪ рд╡рд╛рд╕реНрддрд╡рд╛рдд рдЙрддрд░рд╡реВ рд╢рдХрддрд╛рдд.  рджреЗрд╢рд╕реНрде - рдкрд░рджреЗрд╢рд╕реНрде рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдгрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдЧрд╡рд╕рдгреА рдШрд╛рд▓рдд рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдбрдЪрд╛ рдкрд░рд┐рд╕рд╕реНрдкрд░реНрд╢ рд▓рд╛рднрд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпреЗрдХрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдЖрднрд╛рд│рд╛ рдПрд╡рдвреЗ рдХрд░реНрддреБрддреНрд╡ рдирд┐рд░реНрдорд╛рдг рдХрд░реВрди рджреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╕рдВрдзреА рдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдорд╛рдиреНрдп рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдХрд╛рдиреЗ  рд╢реИрдХреНрд╖рдгрд┐рдХ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рд╡рд╕рд╛рдпрд┐рдХ рдкрд░рд┐рдШрд╛рд╡рд░ рдирд┐рд░реНрдорд╛рдг рдХреЗрд▓реА.  *рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгрд╛рдВрддрд┐рдХ рдпрд╛рддрдирд╛ рд╕рд╣рди рдХрд░реВрди рднрд╡рд┐рд╖реНрдп рдШрдбрд╡рд┐рдгрд╛рд░реНрдпрд╛ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдгрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡рд╕рд╛ рдЬреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рд╡рд┐рддреНрд░реАрдмрд╛рдИ рдлреБрд▓реЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдорд╣рд╛рддреНрдорд╛ рдЬреНрдпреЛрддрд┐рд░рд╛рд╡ рдлреБрд▓реЗ рдпрд╛рдВрдиреА рдЖрдпреБрд╖реНрдпрднрд░ рдЬреЛрдкрд╛рд╕рд▓рд╛ , рдЬреНрдпрд╛рдВрдиреА рдЕрдВрдЧрд╛рд╡рд░ рд╢реЗрдг рдЖрдгрд┐ рдорд╛рддреАрдЪреЗ рдорд╛рд░реЗ рд╕рд╣рди рдХрд░рдд рд╕рдорд╛рдЬрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдЙрдЬреНрд╡рд▓ рднрд╡рд┐рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдг рд╡рд╛рдЯ рджрд╛рдЦрд╡рд┐рд▓реА , рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╡рд╛рдЯреЗрд╡рд░рдЪрд╛ рд╣рд╛ рдкрд╛рдВрддрд╕реНрде  рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рд░рдЦреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╣рд╛рд▓ - рдЕрдкреЗрдХреНрд╖рд╛ , рдмрджрдирд╛рдореА ,  рддрд┐рд░рд╕реНрдХрд╛рд░ , ' рдирд╛рд╣реА рд░реЗ ' рд╡рд░реНрдЧрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЕрд╕реНрддрд┐рддреНрд╡рд╛рдЪреА рдЬрд╛рдгреАрд╡ рд╕рд╣рди рдХрд░рдд рдХрд░рдд рд╕рд░рд╕реНрд╡рддреАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рди рдордВрджрд┐рд░рд╛рддреАрд▓ рдорд╛рдирд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ 'рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рд╛рд╕рдирд╛' рд╡рд░ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЬрдорд╛рди рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛.* рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдХреНрд╖-рдЕрдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдХреНрд╖рдкрдгреЗ рдкрд╛рдЪ рд▓рд╛рдЦ рдХреБрдЯреБрдВрдмрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЪрд░рд┐рддрд╛рд░реНрдерд╛рдЪрд╛ рдорд╣рд╛рдХреБрдВрдн рдЕрд╕рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдб рдордзреАрд▓ рд╣рд╛ рдЕрдореГрдд рдХрд▓рд╢ рдпрд╛ рд▓рд╛рдЦреЛ рдХреБрдЯреБрдВрдмреАрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдореГрджреНрдзреАрдЪрд╛ рдореВрд▓рдордВрддреНрд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ  ,
рд╕рдореЛрд░ рдпреЗрдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдиреНрдпрд╛рдп рджреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рджрд╛рдирд╢реВрд░рддрд╛ , рддреНрдпрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдореЛрдардВ рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдХреГрддреАрд╢реАрд▓рддрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдЪрд╛рд░рд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╕рдореГрджреНрдз рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░реЗ рд╕рдВрдХрд▓реНрдк рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдордирд╛рдордзреНрдпреЗ рдкреЗрд░рдд рд╣рдЬрд╛рд░реЛ рд▓реЛрдХ рдПрдо рдПрди рдирд╡рд▓реЗ рдирд╛рд╡рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдорд╛рдгрд╕рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд┐рджреНрдпрд╛рдкреАрдард╛рддреВрди рд╕рдореГрджреНрдз рдЭрд╛рд▓реЗ .

*рдКрд░реНрдЬрд╛ рд╣реА рдиреЗрд╣рдореА рдКрд░реНрдзреНрд╡рдЧрд╛рдореА рдЕрд╕рддреЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рддрд┐рдЪрд╛ рдорд╛рд░реНрдЧ рддреА рд╕рддрдд рд╢реЛрдзрдд рдЕрд╕рддреЗ , рд╣реА рдКрд░реНрдЬрд╛ рджрдбрдкреВрди рдЯрд╛рдХрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдкреНрд░рдпрддреНрди рд╣реЛрдд рдЕрд╕рддрд╛рдирд╛ ,  рддреА рдХрдзреА ' рд╕реНрд╡рддрдВрддреНрд░ '  рд╣реЛрддреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ рдореНрд╣рдгреВрди рддрд░ рдХрдзреА рд╕рдВрдкрдиреНрди рд╣реЛрддреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ рдореНрд╣рдгреВрди ....  рдХрдзреА рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛рддреАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдкрд░реАрдШрд╛рдмрд╛рд╣реЗрд░реАрд▓ рдШрдЯрдХрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реНрдард╛ рджреЗрддреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ рдореНрд╣рдгреВрди ...... рддреА рджрд╛рдмрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╕рддрдд рдкреНрд░рдпрддреНрди рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдпрд╛рдЪ рдкреНрд░рдпрддреНрдирд╛рдд рдЕрдиреЗрдХрд╛рдВрдиреА рдЕрдиреНрдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рдЖрд╕реВрдб ,  рдмрджрдирд╛рдореАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдХреИрд░реА рдЭрд╛рдбрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдкрд░рдВрддреБ рдпрд╛ рд╕рдЧрд│реНрдпрд╛рд╡рд░ рдорд╛рдд рдХрд░реВрди рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдбрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЧрдЧрдирдЪреБрдВрдмреА рдЗрдорд╛рд░рддреАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╣рд╛рд╡реНрдпрд╛ рдордЬрд▓реНрдпрд╛рд╡рд░ рд╣рд╛ рд░рд╛рдЬрд╣рдВрд╕ рдЖрдЬрд╣реА рдордирд╕реЛрдХреНрдд рдмрд╛рдЧрдбрддреЛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рддрд┐рддрдХреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рджрд┐рдорд╛рдЦрд╛рдиреЗ рдЖрдкрд▓реЗ рд╡рд┐рд╣рд┐рдд рдХрд╛рд░реНрдп рджреЗрдЦреАрд▓ рдкреВрд░реНрдг рдХрд░рддреЛ рдЖрд╣реЗ.* 

рдирд╛ рдХреБрдгрд╛рдЪреА рдлрд┐рдХреАрд░ , рдирд╛ рдХреБрдгрд╛рдЪреА рдЗрд░реНрд╖рд╛ , рдирд╛ рдХреБрдгрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╕реВрдб рдШреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рднрд╛рд╡рдирд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдирд╛ рдХреБрдгрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдкреЛрд╕рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд▓рд╛рдЪрд╛рд░реА .....  рджреЗрд╢ рд╡рд┐рджреЗрд╢рд╛рдд рдкрд╕рд░рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдбрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рдЯрд╡реГрдХреНрд╖рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдкрд╛рд░рдВрдмреНрдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрдЦреАрди рдмрд│рдХрдЯ рдХрд╢рд╛ рд╣реЛрддреАрд▓ рдпрд╛ рдзреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдиреЗ рдЕрдЦрдВрдб рдЪрд╛рд░ рджрд╢рдХреЗ рд╣рд╛ рдХрд░реНрдордпрдЬреНрдЮ рдЕрд╡реНрдпрд╛рд╣рдд рд╕реБрд░реВ рдЖрд╣реЗ .

*рдиреИрддрд┐рдХ рдЕрдиреИрддрд┐рдХрддреЗрдЪреНрдпрд╛  , рд╕рддреНрдп - рдЕрд╕рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╡рд╛рд╕реНрддрд╡рд╛рдЪреЗ рднрд╛рди рди рдареЗрд╡рдд рд╡реГрддреНрддрдкрддреНрд░реАрдп рд░рдХрд╛рдиреНрдпрд╛рдВрдордзреВрди рдЙрдбрд╡рд▓реЗрд▓реЗ рд╢рд╛рдИрдЪреЗ рд╢рд┐рдВрддреЛрдбреЗ рдпрд╛ рджрд┐рд╡реНрдп - рджрд╛рд╣рдХ рдорд╣рд╛ рдпрдЬреНрдЮрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХрд▓рдВрдХрд┐рдд рдХрд░реВ рд╢рдХрд▓реЗ рдирд╛рд╣реАрдд.* рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдг рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рд╛рдд рдЖрдЬ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдб рдЪреА рдЬреА рднрд╡реНрдпрддрд╛ рдЙрднреА рд░рд╛рд╣рд┐рд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ , рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдмрд░реЛрдмрд░реА рдЖрдЬ рдпрд╛ рдкрдВрдЪрдХреНрд░реЛрд╢реАрддреАрд▓ рдПрдХрд╣реА рд╕рдВрд╕реНрдерд╛ рдХрд░реВ рд╢рдХрдд рдирд╛рд╣реА ..

рднрд╛рд░рддрд╛рдд рдкреНрд▓реЗрд╕рдореЗрдВрдЯ рдордзреНрдпреЗ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдХреНрд░рдорд╛рдВрдХ , рдорд╣рд╛рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░рд╛рдд рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдлрд│рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рджреГрд╖реНрдЯрд┐рдХреЛрдирд╛рддреВрди рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рд╡рд┐рд╕реНрддреАрд░реНрдг рдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдлрд│рд╛рдВрдЪрд╛ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдХреНрд░рдорд╛рдВрдХрд╛рдЪреЗ рдХреЕрдореНрдкрд╕ ,  рджреЗрд╢-рд╡рд┐рджреЗрд╢рд╛рдд рдиреЛрдХрд░реАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдзреА  рдорд┐рд│рд╛рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдЙрдореЗрджрд╡рд╛рд░рд╛рдВрдордзреНрдпреЗ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдХреНрд░рдорд╛рдВрдХрд╛рдЪреА рд╕рдВрд╕реНрдерд╛, рдЕрдЬрд╕реНрддреНрд░ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдЕрд╡рд╛рдврд╡реНрдп рдЗрдиреНрдлреНрд░рд╛рд╕реНрдЯреНрд░рдХреНрдЪрд░ , рд╕рд╣реНрдпрд╛рджреНрд░реАрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдбреЛрдВрдЧрд░рд╛рдВрдирд╛ рдХрд╡реЗрдд рдШреЗрдКрди рддреНрдпрд╛рд╡рд░ рдирдВрджрдирд╡рди рдлреБрд▓рд╡рд┐рдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рдиреИрддрд┐рдХ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдгрд╛рдЪреА рдЧрдВрдЧреЛрддреНрд░реА рдЖрдгрд┐ рддрд┐рддрдХреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╡рд┐рд╢рд╛рд▓ рд╕рд╣реНрдпрд╛рджреНрд░реАрд╕рд╛рд░рдЦреЗ рдХрдгрдЦрд░ рдЕрд╕рд▓реЗрд▓реЗ рдорди рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗ рдПрдо рдПрди рдирд╡рд▓реЗ рд╣рд╛ рдЕрдореГрддрдХреБрдВрдн  !  рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╢рддрдХреЛрддреНрддрд░ рд╡рд╛рдЯрдЪрд╛рд▓ рд╡реНрд╣рд╛рд╡реА рдЖрдгрд┐ рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдирд┐рд░рд╛рдордп рд╢рддрд╛рдмреНрджреА рдкреВрд░реНрддреАрдЪрд╛ рдЙрддреНрд╕рд╡ рд╕рд╛рдЬрд░рд╛ рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╕рдВрдзреА рдпрд╛ рд╕рд╣реНрдпрд╛рджреНрд░реАрд▓рд╛ рдорд┐рд│рд╛рд╡реА ,  рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣рдЧрдбрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдХрдбреНрдпрд╛ -  рдХрдкрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛рддреВрди рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рдирд┐рдирд╛рдж рдШреБрдорд╛рд╡реЗрдд рдЖрдгрд┐ рддреНрдпрд╛ рд╕реЛрд╣рд│реНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ рд╕рд╛рдХреНрд╖реАрджрд╛рд░ рд╣реЛрдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╕рдВрдзреА рдЖрдореНрд╣рд╛ рд╕рд░реНрд╡ рдкрд╛рдВрдерд╕реНрдерд╛рдирд╛ рдорд┐рд│рд╛рд╡реА рд╣реАрдЪ рдордирдГрдкреВрд░реНрд╡рдХ рд╢реБрднреЗрдЪреНрдЫрд╛ !

1/18/23, 13:52 - +91 98905 65810: Internship program 2023
at Nethermind 
Batch: 2023-2024                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Location: Remote                                                                                                                   We are a team of world class builders and researchers with expertise across several domains: Ethereum Protocol Engineering, Layer-2, Decentralized Finance (DeFi), Miner Extractable Value (MEV), Smart Contract Development, Security Auditing and Formal Verification.

Working to solve some of the most challenging problems in the blockchain space, we frequently collaborate with renowned companies, such as Ethereum Foundation, StarkWare, Gnosis Chain, Aave, Flashbots, xDai, Open Zeppelin, Forta Protocol, Energy Web, POA Network and many more.

We actively contribute to Ethereum core development, EIP's and network upgrades together with the Ethereum Foundation, and other client teams.

Today, there are nearly 200 of us working remotely from over 45+ countries.     NethermindтАЩs commitment to our interns

As an intern at Nethermind, you'll be given full autonomy to decide what projects you want to work on, what skills you want to gain or refine, and which teams you want to work with. We will encourage and push you to succeed.

This internship aims to provide you with a valuable learning experience. Our goal is to help you develop new skills, expand your knowledge, and to acquire practical experience in your field of interest. We hope that with a rich learning environment, guidance and support, you will grow and thrive during your time with us. We are committed to providing all interns with opportunities to learn and challenge themselves, and we will do what we can to help you achieve your goals and make the most of the internship here at Nethermind.

 

How does the Internship work?
Many of these topics are new to me; can I have study time?

We allow the study time you require for anything related to what we do.

What are the working hours?

Our working hours are flexible to suit the needs of the individual. You must be available for a minimum of 20 hours per week to get the best out of the internship program.

Where is it located?

We are a globally distributed team, and we are a remote-first organization. Our entire team works fully remotely.

Is it paid?

Yes, our internship program is paid. You will either be paid your countryтАЩs national minimum wage or $6.25 per hour, whichever is greater.

NB: There are certain countries where we have some difficulty paying you directly in fiat currency i.e. dollars or GBP. For these countries, you will be paid in cryptocurrency. Please speak to a member of our team to confirm if this will affect you.

When does it start?

Our internship program is open all year round, and you can apply anytime.

What is the duration of the internship?

The internship duration is flexible and can range from 1-3 months, depending on the availability of the individual. Most of our interns stay in the program for the full three months.

Is it possible to extend the duration of the internship?

The internship program has a set duration and cannot be lengthened or extended beyond the specified time frame.

Do you hold a daily stand-up meeting?

Yes. Each team holds a daily stand-up meeting to discuss what each team member is working on, and it is an opportunity to ask questions.

Will I have a mentor?

Yes. All interns are assigned a mentor with whom they can seek help and guidance.

What tool do you use for communication?

We use Slack daily, and it is our primary medium of communication. All interns are added to our Slack workspace.

What teams can I work with?

Throughout the internship, you can choose to work in one or more of the following groups depending on your skills, knowledge, and preference.                                                           we look for passion and hunger to work in the blockchain, Ethereum, and DeFi space.                                                          Apply:  https://boards.eu.greenhouse.io/nethermind/jobs/4104204101

1/18/23, 14:26 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *Guidelines for students those who are ready to go for Internship*
1. ЁЭРБЁЭРЮ ЁЭРйЁЭРлЁЭРЮЁЭРйЁЭРЪЁЭРлЁЭРЮЁЭРЭ ЁЭРЯЁЭРиЁЭРл ЁЭРлЁЭРЮЁЭРЪЁЭРЭЁЭРвЁЭРзЁЭРа: You won't be getting youtube videos to do your daily stuff, but documentations are going to help you a lot. From setting up your system to solving a completely new issue, reading will take you out from any issue.

2. ЁЭРБЁЭРЮ ЁЭРйЁЭРлЁЭРЮЁЭРйЁЭРЪЁЭРлЁЭРЮЁЭРЭ ЁЭРЯЁЭРиЁЭРл ЁЭРЪ ЁЭРзЁЭРЮЁЭР░ ЁЭРнЁЭРЮЁЭРЬЁЭРб ЁЭРмЁЭРнЁЭРЪЁЭРЬЁЭРд: If you are not hired for a specific position(Ex: Android Dev Intern) then you might have to work on a completely new tech stack.

3. ЁЭРГЁЭРиЁЭРз'ЁЭРн ЁЭРнЁЭРбЁЭРвЁЭРзЁЭРд ЁЭРиЁЭРЯ ЁЭРПЁЭРПЁЭРО: Yes, don't take too much pressure for a PPO/conversion. Have it as a long term goal but don't pressurise yourself to work in worst conditions.

4. ЁЭРАЁЭРмЁЭРд ЁЭРзЁЭРвЁЭРЬЁЭРЮЁЭРеЁЭР▓: If you are stuck at a point, try to search on Google/Stack Overflow and then ask your mentor with your research. Always have a positive approach while asking.

5. ЁЭРГЁЭРиЁЭРз'ЁЭРн ЁЭРЯЁЭРЮЁЭРЪЁЭРл ЁЭРнЁЭРи ЁЭРЪЁЭРмЁЭРд: You mentors, Senior Engineers, Managers are going to be your success ladder. Ask if you are stuck, ask if you need suggestions, ask if you want discussions. Obviously they have more work than you but they always try to take out some time for interns.

It is┬аa┬аmatter┬аof┬аgreat pride┬аthat in view of the idea of a sustained and structured cultural┬а connect between people of different regions as was┬а mooted by HonтАЩble Prime Minister during the Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, Ministry of Education of GoI has conceptualized an initiative of тАШYuva SangamтАЩ with an aim to┬а strengthen people to people connect and build empathy between youth of the North eastern states and other States by conducting EXPOSURE┬а VISITS of students/youth between NE region and┬а other States., along with various other ministries.

Yuva Sangam (рдпреБрд╡рд╛ рд╕рдВрдЧрдо) under Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat (EBSB) is an initiative by Government of India to strengthen people to people connect especially between youth belonging to North Eastern India and other States.Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat Yuva Sangam (рдпреБрд╡рд╛ рд╕рдВрдЧрдо) will focus on conducting exposure tours of youth between the 8 North Eastern States and other States. It will provide an immersive experience of various facets of life, development landmarks, recent achievements and youth connect in the host state.During their visits, the youth will have a multi-dimensional exposure under five broad areas тАУ┬аParyatan (Tourism), Parampara (Traditions), Pragati (Development), Prodyogik (Technology) and Paraspar Sampark (People-to-people connect).┬а

A prestigious event of YUVA SANGAM PORTAL LAUNCH is scheduled to be held at IGNCA Auditorium on 6th February, 2023 at 5:30 PM onwards. яВ╖ Live Projects - Get hands-on experience by working on real-life projects.
яВ╖ Building Programming Mindset - Develop a problem-solving approach and a growth mindset through coding.
яВ╖ On-Campus Placement Drives - Get a chance to showcase your skills during on- campus placement drives.
яВ╖ Weekly Coding Assignments - Enhance your coding skills by working on weekly coding assignments.
яВ╖ Build and Showcase Portfolio - Create a portfolio of your work and showcase it to potential employers.
яВ╖ Certification from IIT Bombay E-Cell - *Get a certificate of completion from IIT Bombay E-Cell.*
яВ╖ Scholarship opportunities - Selected students will get 100% scholarship in employer- sponsored programs.
яВ╖ Free Access to Emerging Tech Trends - Stay updated with the latest tech trends through free access to the EJET Gain app.
яВ╖ Final Year Fellowship Program - Get the opportunity to work on a final year project with the final year fellowship program.

*We believe that CodinClub will be a valuable addition to your learning journey and help you stand out during campus interviews.* So, don't miss this opportunity and register now!

2/23/23, 10:35 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *Campus placement drive no. 2 for 2024 batch*
Dear Dr.Sameer Katekar,
 
Greetings from Codemind Technology!
 
Hope you are doing well.
 
We would like to extend the opportunity of campus recruitment program for 2024 B.E./ B.TECH batch in Codemind Technology. 
I am sure the association with our organization, will give the students quality training experience and help them to get their dream job.
 
*We will prefer student from 2024 pass out batch only* and can readily join the Campus Connect Program in April-May 2024 (Tentative) as per college permission and examination schedule.
 
Student Selection Process:
Student Registration. (Please  share this link to student to fill the form ==>> Registration Link)
 Aptitude Test.
Technical Interview.
HR Interview for final discussion.
 
Training Details for selected students:
Mode: Online
Duration: 90 days  
Schedule - Monday to Friday (1.5 hrs / per day)
Time: Evening - After college hours
 
Key points:  
We DOES NOT CHARGE any candidate as the program is under CSR activities.
Campus Connect Program provides  100% Placement Assistance.
Codemind does not charge any candidate for Interviews and Placement under this program
Campus Connect Program Includes тАЬCore Java & J2EE, SQL, Aptitude , SoftSkill, Resume Preparation, Interview guidance and Company specific groomingтАЭ
 
Please note Eligibility Criteria:
B.E./ B.TECH 2024 passout candidates & immediate joiner.
First Class (60%) or above in 10th, 12th and graduation (upto last semester)
No academic year gap in 10th, 12th, diploma and degree.
B.E./ B.TECH Stream eligible for Campus Connect Program (CS/ IT / E&TC /EE / Civil / Mech stream).
Good verbal and written English communication.
Have own laptop/PC for practice purpose.
Should be willing to pursue a career in Software Industry
Should be ready to get Trained for a period of 3 to 4 months minimum.
Should be open to relocate to cities (Pune / Mumbai) for Job / Placements.
 
Terms & Conditions for Campus Connect Program
Candidates must have more than 90% attendance.
Candidates should be Ready to Relocate to different cities for the Job/Interviews(Pune & Mumbai).
Candidate should complete the assignments on time and should vocal
Candidate should actively participate in Mock interviews and Project Developemt
Candidates should submit Letter of Intent, Photo Identity Proof, Address Proof and Two passport size photographs on the date of training on boarding.
Codemind will hold the rights of Training & Placement in regards to discipline & sincerity of the candidates.

Please share the link (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfD3k1hdYqf9_Sy56N-fb2jhuObUfruFulDENidBccVeAvJfw/viewform)with student and request you please make them mandatory to submit the details.
 

Please let us know in case more information required, We are happy to assist you! 


Your Sincerely,

2/23/23, 17:39 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *A few days back someone asked me how to get a paid means salary based internship.*

Here are a few methods that I have tried and that really work

ЁЯСЙ *Internship cells* -
Every college has its internship cell where students are provided with many opportunities to intern with startups , big 4s .
There are high chances of your selection as you compete with those of your level only .

ЁЯСЙ *LinkedIn*
There are ample opportunities posted on LinkedIn jobs where you can easily apply or apply through the link given .
You can apply various kinds of filters here to niche down your search

ЁЯСЙ *Cold emailing*
Most underrated method which really works.
You can find the ids of recruiters via many ways and can mail them with a good and personalised mail with your cv .

ЁЯСЙ *Unstop (formerly Dare2Compete)*
One stop destination for all college students to apply for jobs, Internships, contests and many more

ЁЯСЙ *Internshala*
Many people use internshala to find internships. *However , I don't have a good experience with it hence putting it on my least priority list*

3/1/23, 20:13 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Good evening friends.. During TodayтАЩs interaction, few TPOs asked about Test Pattern & Syllabus for MaTPO Aptitude Idol тАУ 2023. 

Please find the details as follows :

Total number of questions: 60
Total marks: 60
Duration: 60 minutes
No negative marking
Number of attempt per student: 1

Number of Sections: 3 (English Usage, Numerical Ability, Analytical Reasoning).
Section-1: English Usage тАУ 20 questions for 20 marks
Sentence Correction, Speech, Tense, Gerund, Articles, Prepositions, Reading Comprehensions, Synonyms and Antonyms, Vocabulary, Phrases & Idioms, Sequencing.
Section-2: Numerical Ability тАУ 20 questions for 20 marks 
Data Interpretation, Equations, Mathematical Modelling, Mensuration, Number Systems, Percentages, Probability, Time & Work.
Section-3: Analytical Reasoning тАУ 20 questions for 20 marks
Coding-Decoding, Series, Data Sufficiency, Flow Charts, Case Puzzles, Odd one out, Statement- Conclusions, Visual Reasoning.

Dear Sir / Ma'am,

Greetings from *Maharashtra Association of Training & Placement Officers* (MaTPO) and *Government of MaharashtraтАЩs Directorate of Technical Education* (DTE)!!!

We are happy to share with you that MaTPO in association with Government of MaharashtraтАЩs DTE have organized *"MaTPO Aptitude Idol-2023", an online aptitude competition* for Maharashtra Students from First Year to Final Year of B.E. / B.Tech. / M.E. / M.Tech. / Diploma / BCA / MCA / BCS / MCS / BBA / MBA / B.Sc. / M.Sc. / B.Pharm. / M.Pharm and other courses. *Our objective is to improve the Employability of our Maharashtra students so that they can get more job offers.*

*тЧП Date & Time of Round-1 (Online Aptitude Test):* 11th March 2023, Saturday from 08:00 am to 07:00 pm 

*тЧП Duration of this online aptitude test:* 60 minutes 

*тЧП Venue:* Your own college (request to TPOs / HODs / Class Teachers and Other Concern people to make the necessary arrangements for the online aptitude test for your students in batches as per number of students)

We request you to make it Compulsory to all students so that Placement % / Internship % of your institute improves to a great extent. All Departments HODs are requested to make arrangements for test of their students. 

Please share this information with students at the earliest so that they can prepare for 8-10 days to get expected output.

*тЧП Who can participate?:* Student from any college across Maharashtra from First Year to Final Year of B.E. / B.Tech. / M.E. / M.Tech. / Diploma / BCA / MCA / BCS / MCS / BBA / MBA / B.Sc. / M.Sc. / B.Pharm. / M.Pharm. and Other Courses

*3. No charges are applicable to participate.*

3/10/23, 19:42 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *ЁЯФЦMaTPO Aptitude Idol-2023 | 11th March 2023, Saturday | From 8:00 am to 7:00 pm | Some guidelines about Online Aptitude TestЁЯФЦ*

Dear Student,

Before starting the test, kindly go through the below details:

*тЧП Test Instructions Manual:* https://tinyurl.com/Test-Instructions-MAI-23
 and 

тЧП It is mandatory for student to appear for the test from his / her own college. And he / she has to sign the attendance.

тЧП Test can be given on Laptop, Desktop, Tab, Smartphone (mobile), etc. But it needs strong internet connectivity.

тЧП Students will receive the email containing test link, login credentials and pass key from Aon-Cocubes till today evening.

*тЧП Test window will open on 11th March 2023 at 8:00 am and will close at 7:00 pm.*

*тЧП Test duration:* 60 minutes

*тЧП Total marks:* 60

*тЧП No negative marking*

*тЧП Number of attempt per student:* 1

*тЧП Total number of questions:* 60

*тЧП Test syllabus:*
*тЦкя╕О Section-1:* English Usage (20 questions for 20 marks)
*тЦкя╕О Section-2:* Numerical Ability (20 questions for 20 marks)
*тЦкя╕О Section-3:* Analytical Reasoning (20 questions for 20 marks)

*тЧП For any query, students can drop an email or contact MaTPO representatives:*

3/11/23, 05:50 - Sameer Katekar Sir: ЁЯФЦProgramming contest for students of First Year to Final Year: "MaTPO PROGRAMMING IDOL-2023", an online coding competition for Maharashtra students organized by Maharashtra Association of Training & Placement Officers (MaTPO) in association with Government of MaharashtraтАЩs Directorate of Technical Education (DTE), Geeks for Geeks (GFG) and NASSCOM FutureSkills on Saturday, 18th March 2023 in 3 slots || Question paper for each year is different || Test Pattern & Syllabus is attached || Test can be given from Home / College || Last Date to register: 15th March 2023 till 04:00 pmЁЯФЦ

Dear Sir / Ma'am,

Greetings from Maharashtra Association of Training & Placement Officers (MaTPO), Government of MaharashtraтАЩs Directorate of Technical Education (DTE), Geeks for Geeks (GFG) and NASSCOM FutureSkills!!!

We are happy to share with you that MaTPO, DTE, GFG and NASSCOM FutureSkills have organized "MaTPO Programming Idol-2023", an online coding competition for Maharashtra Students from First Year to Final Year of B.E. / B.Tech. / M.E. / M.Tech. / Diploma / BCA / MCA / BCS / MCS / BBA / MBA / B.Sc. / M.Sc. / B.Pharm. / M.Pharm. and other courses. Our objective is to improve the employability of our Maharashtra students so that they can get more job offers.

тЧП Date & Time of Round-1 (Online Coding Test): 18th March 2023, Saturday in 3 Slots as follows:

(Question paper for each year is different. Hence students must appear in the slot allotted to particular year like Final year / Pre Final year / First & Second year for UG / PG / Diploma)
тЦкя╕О Slot 1 тАУ 10:00 am to 12:00 pm тАУ Final year тАУ UG/PG
тЦкя╕О Slot 2 тАУ 12:30 pm to 02:30 pm тАУ Pre Final year тАУ UG/PG
тЦкя╕О Slot 3 тАУ 03:00 pm to 05:00 pm тАУ First & Second year тАУ UG/Diploma

тЧП Duration: 2 hrs

тЧП Venue: You can give the test from your Home or College

тЧП Pattern of programming test:
1. The coding contest consists of a total 3 coding-based situational Data Structure & Algorithms (DSA) questions in each slot.
2. Languages supported for the contest are C++, Java and Python.
3. Any type of Plagiarism will not be entertained. If anyone is caught doing that the score of the concerned participant will get 0. 

тЧП Student Registration Link: https://tinyurl.com/MPI-23-Reg 

тЧП Test Pattern & Syllabus: https://tinyurl.com/Syllabus-MPI-23

тЧП Win exciting Prizes: Laptop, Mobile, Tab, Fitbit, Bag, etc.

We need quick learners with strong communication skills, proactive and positive attitude. Basis the overall performance, there are good chances that we will prefer them for final placement.

4/11/23, 13:38 - Sameer Katekar Sir: IITB Trust Lab is calling on all UG/PG students across the country to apply
for the Trust Lab Internship Program.
We request you to kindly spread the word about the internship program
announced by Trust Lab.

Housed in the Computer Science and Engineering Department of IIT Bombay, the
Trust LabтАЩs activities encompass scientific research, technology development
and fostering an ecosystem catering to the needs of academia, industry and
society. IITB Trust Lab currently has about two dozen eminent faculty members
guiding and mentoring students in various areas of digital trust. Current
research topics span hardware and software systems security, cryptography,
networks, blockchains, formal methods, game theory, AI/ML, pedagogy and
public policy.

The 9-month Internship program (May-December 2023) at Trust Lab is an
excellent opportunity for UG/PG students with a natural curiosity in the
domain of digital privacy to expand their knowledge base or validate their
career interests by testing themselves in a competitive education
environment.

The internship will combine virtual and onsite work. Out of the 9 months,
interns will be spending 3 months on the IIT Bombay campus. Trust Lab will
make suitable arrangements for accommodation and offer a competitive stipend
to all interns for the 3 months that they spend on campus. Train fare (Class
3 AC) will be provided to defray travel costs.

The last date for receiving applications is April 12, 2023. As part of the
selection round, all applicants must mandatorily complete a multi-module
course created by Trust Lab, take a qualifying quiz, and create a short video
on the same.

Interested students must submit their details using the following link:
https://bit.ly/tl-internship

We are planning to conduct the Round-2 of MaTPO Aptitude Idol-2023 and MaTPO Programming Idol-2023 as per the below schedule:

тЧП MaTPO Aptitude Idol-2023: (Online test of Round-2 will happen on Aon-Cocubes platform)
тЦкя╕О Date of Round-2: 29th April 2023, Saturday 
тЦкя╕О Time: 10:30 am to 11:30 am
тЦкя╕О Venue: Your own college (under the supervision of TPO / Faculty)
тЦкя╕О Note for following shortlisted students: You should be a student of current first year to final year and not a passed out student. You must have taken the test of Round-1 from your college only. If we found that you are not an eligible student then you will be disqualified.

TechSaksham Marketplace gives them access to job opportunities, they can upload their resume and avail the job opportunities posted by TechSaksham placement team 

Students share Stories, Testimonials and Faculty member role in strengthening their learning journey and creating an impact.

5/4/23, 09:38 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear TPOs, 

Today is the last day to register current TE (2024 BE passout) students for CoCubes. 

The benefits of CoCubes are not only limited to knowing how employable is a student and where improvements are required. CoCubes assessments will help students to prepare for industryтАЩs placement drive assessment exam which are kind of similar in structure (it will give the students a feel of real placement test and prepare them for the eventual). Also, good scores in CoCubes assessments will open up high package profiles in future. 

For those aiming for higher study abroad, CoCubes will help such students assess their preparation for the mathematical logical and communication aptitude of GRE. 

Thus, I kindly request you all to re-counsel the students and get them to register for the assessment. We want all TE students on roll call  to register. If required, seek help of your respected Principal. I have already spoken with your principal.

Thank you

1st Compulsory Placement test ( aptitude and technical ) :

It's mandatory to attempt the test...


Dear Student,

As part of next step towards IndiaтАЩs First Tech Talent Hunt with Recrewt. You will be having assessment on 14th May 2023 at time given to you.. ItтАЩs going to be a proctored assessment you can take it from your college.

The assessment is for 2.5hrs.

Steps of Taking Assessment :-

Login through credentials received from recrewt@techademy.net > On Home page click on My Assessment > Click on Not Started Tab > Choose your assessment as per skill of your choice.

Instructions for Assessment :-

(1). Take the Assessment in Incognito Window only.

(2). Take the assessment on your laptop or Desktop exclusively. Please do not take the assessment in tabs or phones.

Kindly, take the assessment in a noise-free area.

Please do not move away from the full-screen mode/assessment tab as that would be considered as a violation of assessment rules and the session will terminate.

Do not Toggle between the tabs as it would be considered as a violation and exceeding the allowed limit would lead to test termination.

Please take the assessment in one go without breaks.

Make sure that you take the assessment in a private area/college premises and there shouldn't be anyone else in the room.

So, For assessment we have three Sections: 

Aptitude => 18+18+24 = 60 marks
Tech. Assessment => 60question = 60 marks
Coding => 2 questions


Plz note their is no technical support available for the test, so don't call TPO in case any difficulty occured during the test... You are solely responsible for the test requirements...

We are happy to bring to you Pod, a platform that streamlines placements process. This platform will provide, students, access to, Pod, a AI powered placement software that helps you find job and career development opportunities. 

For the 2024 graduating batch, Pod will be used by the CPC and itтАЩs recruiting partners to find qualified candidates like you, and it will be a great way to connect with potential employers and get your foot in the door of your desired industry.

*By paying an access fee of around 88.50 rupees,* you will have full access to all of the features of the platform, including job search and application tools and career development resources. Most importantly, you will be able to create a resume, apply for jobs and internships, build a professional network, and receive career advice and guidance. Thus, you are kindly requested to create login by paying the required fees. Thereafter, you will be trained and guided to upload and update your credentials on the platform. 

At the time of registration you have to fill all correct details if any one found misleading us, strict actions will be taken.

*Use your mail id as per given instructions*
*For eg*:-*hrishiwarunkar.scoe.comp@gmail.com* / *hrishiwarunkar24.scoe.comp@gmail.com*

Team CPC

7/2/23, 11:36 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Respected Yogesh Sir,

 

Greetings from FUEL!

 

Please find below test URL & login details.


B.E/B.Tech





 


Candidates can use our chat support with the below URL if they face any challenges during the test.

 
Hardware and Internet requirements:

тАвA Personal Computer / Laptop. Please donтАЩt take the test from Mobile Browser.

тАвA Webcam connected with the System/In-built Webcam in a laptop.

тАвSmooth and uninterrupted Internet connectivity (throughout the testing session), minimum 1 MBPS/4G.

Browser/OS Requirements:

тАвThis Assessment is supported by the below-listed Browsers/Versions only.

тАвGoogle Chrome (version 40 and above)

тАвMozilla Firefox (version 40 and above)

тАвIn case you're taking the test on Windows 8, make sure you use the latest version and disable all the popups/ notifications


DoтАЩs & DonтАЩt- Instructions:

тАвComplete the test in one go, no breaks allowed in-between.

тАвThis is a timed test; it is essential to keep track of time while answering the questions.

тАвAnswer all the questions and complete all the modules.

тАвThere is no negative marking.

тАвYou cannot change your answer to any previous question.

тАвDo not click on Module Exit or Test Exit.

тАвEnsure that while taking the test, no other tab/window/link is opened simultaneously on your system else your scores will not be processed.

тАвDo not try to take screenshots of the test, else your test will be locked & you wonтАЩt be able to complete the test.

тАвPlease disable all POP-UPS/ Notifications before starting the test.

тАвEnsure your face is clearly visible on the webcam. Do not wear a cap, scarf, goggles/ sunglasses, headphones, earphones, etc., or hide your face during the test.

тАвPlease ensure that no one else is sitting with you during the entire duration of the test.


Steps for starting the test:

тАвFor taking the exam type the URL in the address bar of the Web Browser.

тАвEnter the username and password given to you to login. Do not copy-paste the Username and Password. Always type in.

тАвClick on Start New Test.

тАвYou will be automatically prompted to тАШAllowтАЩ your Camera to be enabled, please тАШACCEPTтАЩ the request. This will prompt a message тАШYou Are Under Surveillance'. Your camera is now enabled.

тАвFill the registration form.

тАвClick on Start Test and keep a note of your AMCAT ID as mentioned on the top.

тАвTo answer a question, click on Confirm and then Next to submit your answer. Do not click on Module Exit or Test Exit.

тАвIf your test gets stuck at any point, there is a тАШResume Test' option that will enable you to restart the test at the same place where you got stuck. Please ensure that you Resume the Test within 2 hours of your test being stopped, otherwise your login will expire, and you wonтАЩt be able to complete the test.

тАвMozilla Firefox (version 40 and above)

DoтАЩs & DonтАЩt- Instructions:

тАвComplete the test in one go, no breaks allowed in-between.

тАвAnswer all the questions and complete all the modules.

7/18/23, 17:17 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *SKN Sinhgad College of Engineering, Korti, Pandharpur* 

Introducing *Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC):* Ignite Your Passion for Technology!


Are you ready to shape the future of technology? It's time to unleash your potential and make a difference! We are excited to announce the launch of the *Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC)* at *SKN Sinhgad College of Engineering, Korti, Pandharpur*  GDSC is a platform that empowers students to explore their passion for technology, collaborate with peers, and gain invaluable skills to thrive in the digital world.

At GDSC, we believe in the power of initiative and the importance of choosing your path. We encourage students to take charge and register in their desired domain, whether it's Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Web Development, Mobile App Development, or any other exciting field. By selecting a domain of interest, you can dive deep into the technology you're passionate about and gain specialized knowledge that sets you apart.

Why Join GDSC?

1. *Learning and Skill Development:* GDSC provides an immersive learning experience through workshops, seminars, and hands-on projects. You'll have access to resources, mentors, and industry experts who will guide you in honing your technical skills and keeping up with the latest advancements.

2. *Collaboration and Networking:* GDSC creates a vibrant community where you can connect with like-minded individuals, collaborate on projects, and share knowledge. Expand your network, build lifelong friendships, and find support in your tech journey.

3. *Industry Exposure and Career Opportunities:* GDSC connects you with industry professionals, recruiters, and potential employers. Attend guest lectures, industry visits, and career fairs to gain insights into the tech industry and unlock exciting internship and job opportunities.

Get ready to unleash your potential with GDSC!


 *Registration Link*: https://forms.gle/BkNRDo6YNPYoZFLa9

*Pratiksha Danake* 
*GDSC Community Lead* 
*SKN Sinhgad College of Engineering, Korti, Pandharpur*

8/1/23, 10:21 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear Sir/Madam, 

 

We are delighted to invite you to the third edition of 'd3code,' a nationwide external hackathon organized by UST as part of our Annual Developer Conference, d3 2023. UST is a rapidly growing company that offers advanced computing and digital services to Fortune 500 enterprises worldwide. Driven by the larger purpose of тАЬTransforming LivesтАЭ and the philosophy of тАЬSelect Clients, More Attention,тАЭ we bring in the entrepreneurial spirit that seeks the fastest path to value in todayтАЩs digital economy. 

 

At d3, we bring together the brightest minds from UST and industry experts to share ideas and interact. This year's theme is 'Exploring Generative AI: Crafting the Future.' d3code is an exciting hackathon open to all students currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree, with teams of 2-4 members each. It is an excellent opportunity for students to showcase their passion for innovation, problem-solving, design thinking, and programming skills, with the chance to win amazing prizes.

 

The competition consists of two rounds of online challenges scheduled between August 18th and September 14th. The top 5 teams from these rounds will advance to the final 24-hour Hackathon at UST's campus in Trivandrum, India, on September 30th, 2023. UST will sponsor the travel and accommodation expenses for the finalists.

Here are the cash awards for the top-performing teams:
1st Place: Rs. 7 Lakhs INR
2nd Place: Rs. 5 Lakhs INR
3rd Place: Rs. 3 Lakhs INR
4th and 5th Place: Honorary mentions and Rs. 2 Lakhs INR each.
Moreover, all members of the top teams participating in the final Hackathon will receive job offers at UST, India, along with invitations to d3 2023. The winning team will have an opportunity to present their idea on the grand stage of d3 2023.

To participate in the Hackathon, students can register at Link between July 5th and August 15th, 2023.

8/5/23, 14:23 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *Walmart has launched Sparkathon contest for 2024 & 2025 Batch students!*

It is an open innovation challenge for the student community in India with creative ideas to solve complex problems in retail by applying deep tech.

*Who should apply?*
The hackathon is open to all engineering colleges in India. Students who are pursuing ECE, EE, EEE, IT, and CS are eligible.
The batch of 2024 and 2025 can apply.

Job Title: Graduate Engineer Trainee (GET)

About Worley:
48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
WeтАЩre not just engineers. WeтАЩre a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planetтАЩs toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.? Whatever your ambition, thereтАЩs a path for you here. And thereтАЩs no barrier to your potential career success. For more information,
visit Worley.com 

What we offer you
Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative, and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality, and diversity. If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

Job Description

General Purpose of Role

Under supervision, performs a variety of assignments through the application of basic engineering theories,
techniques, and practices. In development mode being trained in the utilization of relevant regulations,
codes, manufacturing standards, and industry standard practices for the control, development, and
application of deliverables while gaining exposure to procedures and processes.

Technical Competency

Supports adherence to generally accepted engineering and design practices, regulatory requirements, and
customer specifications. Supports the standardization of equipment specifications, drawings, and document
templates. Contributes to the understanding of technical knowledge and customer specifications. Uses
local/global standards to support technical excellence. Supports the processes for checking, peer reviews,
and incorporation of comments and findings.

Qualifications, Accreditation, Training (Essential)

Awarded a Bachelor Degree or Masters Degree in engineering from reputed University

Communication

Communicate basic information with peers, stakeholders, and management. Persuasion is limited to
articulating and substantiating own point of view to peers and supervisors.

People Skills

Teamwork: Enjoys working in a small high calibre team with high visibility to senior stakeholders. Able to
work and liaise with multiple teams and stakeholders, able to prioritise workloads and help other team
members to achieve team goals.

Action Orientation: Achieves results set by self and others, meets timelines, pushes to achieve stretch goals,
and demonstrates enthusiasm, persistence and tenacity. Breaks down work into executable tasks. Acts
accountable for work produced and ensures it is "right the first time.тАЭ

9/4/23, 18:48 - +91 98905 65810: Dear Sir/ Madam,

Greetings!

IdeasтАЩ submissions are invited under тАШTomato Grand ChallengeтАЩ (TGC) launched by the Ministry of Education and Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution. The aim of this challenge is to develop the comprehensive and focused intervention in designing tomato value chain: Pre-production, Primary Processing, Post-Harvest, Storage and Valorisation of Tomato. Registration for the Grand Challenge is currently open. ┬а

The challenge is open to students (engineering, agriculture and allied fields, science or related domains), research scholar, faculty, teachers, professionals, start-ups, Indian companies, MSMEs.

Selected projects will be awarded a prize money and also funded for further development and implementation. More details are available at https://doca.gov.in/gtc/

Submission of ideas is invited from registered participants under one or more of four verticals mentioned below. Participants can submit ideas under more than one verticals.

Registration Link: https://gc.mic.gov.in/register

Registered participants can login at https://gc.mic.gov.in/login and submit their ideas.

Deadline for ideasтАЩ submission is 15th September 2023.

All institutions/ universities/ colleges are requested to circulate the above information about тАШTomato Grand ChallengeтАЩ to all the faculty members, incubators, incubated start-ups, students, research scholars, alumni, etc.

A notification from the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution regarding Tomato Grand Challenge is enclosed.

Vertical 1: Developing and popularizing improved varieties with multiple disease resistance and high shelf-life cultivation technology or practices

for fresh market segment suiting to rainy season, high temperature and moisture stress
for processing segment and mechanization in production.
Vertical 2: Designing and Disseminating information system pertaining to crop planning, production practices, market intelligence, farmer/ trader/ customer interface, etc. (Remote Sensing, Artificial Intelligences, App based platforms etc.)

Vertical 3: Innovative post-harvest treatments, packaging and technologies for long term storage to minimize post- harvest losses during transportation and storage to avoid panic selling due to perishability

Vertical 4: Developing value added products and processes for product diversification including utilization of processing waste, and innovative technologies for value addition to avoid panic selling due to perishability.

More details are available at https://doca.gov.in/gtc/

URL of TGC launch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MQplS-6Uotw

For any related query, please feel free to contact us.

PFA:-┬а

Thanks & Regards,
Dr. Pooja Rawat
Innovation Officer
MoEтАЩs Innovation Cell
AICTE, New Delhi 110070
Email:┬аtgc@aicte-india.org
nnovationofficer1@aicte-india

9/5/23, 13:07 - Sameer Katekar Sir: For 2024 batch Level 2 in detailed syllabus for your reference.

 
4 Modules as below..
C++
ASP.NET & C#.NET
JAVA
Software Testing
 

The complete syllabus is as below:

 

1.C++

Module 1: Introduction to C++ Programming

C++ Compilation Process
Structure of a C++ Program
Basic Syntax and Rules
Variables and Data Types
Input and Output Operations
Basic Operators and Expressions
Control Structures (if-else, switch, loops)
Functions and Function Overloading
Arrays and Strings
Pointers and References
Memory Management (Stack vs Heap)
Scope and Lifetime of Variables
 

Module 2: Object-Oriented Programming in C++

Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
Classes and Objects
Encapsulation and Data Abstraction
Access Specifiers (public, private, protected)
Constructors and Destructors
Member Functions and Data Members
Inheritance and Polymorphism
Function Overriding and Virtual Functions
Abstract Classes and Pure Virtual Functions
Operator Overloading
Static Members and Member Initialization
Friend Functions and Friend Classes
 

Module 3: Introduction to Class and Object Concepts

Constructors and Destructors
Definition and declaration
Characteristics of constructors
Overloaded constructors
Copy constructor
Destructors
Array of objects
Use of constructors
Managing the heap
Passing objects
Objects and references
Overloading copy constructor
Returning objects
Returning object references
Passing and returning pointers to objects
 

Module 4: Polymorphism

Runtime Polymorphism
Virtual Functions and Dynamic Binding
Pointers and Classes
Pointers to Class Members
Method overriding
Base class pointers and derived class objects
Virtual functions
Virtual functions and base class pointers
Virtual functions and base class reference
Dynamic Binding vs Early Binding
Pure virtual functions
Virtual destructors
Abstract classes and applications
Generalization and Specialization
 

Module 5: Exception Handling

Exception handling fundamentals
try, catch, and throw
Using multiple catch statements
The 'catch all' exception handler
Nested try blocks
Rethrowing an exception and overruling a function's return value
Restricting Exceptions - the throw list
Handling derived class exceptions
Setting the terminate and unexpected handlers
Application of Exception handling
 

 

2.Java

 

Module 1: Object-Oriented Programming

Methods and Constructors: Default, Constructors with Arguments
Abstract, Static, and Final
Garbage Collection
Idiosyncrasies of the String class
Cosmic Super class: Object Class
Exception Handling
FILE IO: Data Handling and Functions
String Handling: String, String Buffer Classes
 

Module 2: Packages and Multi-Threading

Multi-Threading: Runnable Interface, Extending a Thread Class
Synchronization in Threads
 

Module 3: Exception Handling

Try, Catch, Finally, Throw, and Throws
 

Module 4: Wrapper Classes and Inner Classes

Integer, Character, Boolean, Float, etc.
Collections: Array List, Vector, HashSet, Tree Set, HashMap, Hash Table, Wildcards
 

Module 5: Java 8 Features

Base 64 encoding/decoding
Default and static methods in Interfaces
Functional Interfaces and Lambda Expressions
Streams
 

Module 6: Parser

DOM Parser: Writing into an XML file and Parsing an XML file
SAX Parser
XSL
 

 

3.C# .Net & ASP.Net

 

Module 1: Understanding .NET

The C# Environment
.NET Strategy
.NET Framework
Common Language Runtime (CLR)
JIT & IL (Intermediate Language)
Automatic Memory Management
Framework Base Classes: System, Exception
Visual Studio 2022
.NET Languages
Benefits of .NET
C# and .NET
Overview of .NET Framework & .NET Core 3.1 with new features of .NET 6
Nunits: Unit Testing Framework for C#
 

Module 2: Overview of C#

Simple C# Program
Namespaces
Comments
Main function
Classes
Console.WriteLine
Command-line Arguments
Compile-time Errors
Program Structure
Coding Style
 

Module 3: Application & Libraries

Console class
Console Input and Output
Formatted Output
Numeric, String, and Date Formatting
Reusable Component - Class Library - DLL
 

Module 4: Literals, Variables & Data Types

Literals
Variables
Data Types
var Keyword
Value Types
Reference Types
Variable Declaration & Initialization
Default Values
Constant Variables
Scope of Variables
Boxing & Unboxing
 

Module 5: Operators & Expressions

Arithmetic Operators
Relational Operators
Logical Operators
Assignment Operators
Increment and Decrement Operators
Conditional Operators
Bitwise Operators
Evaluation of Expressions
Precedence and Associativity
Type Conversion
Math Functions
 

Module 6: Decision Making and Branching

If-Else
Switch
Ternary Operator
 

Module 7: Decision Making and Looping

While Loop
Do-While Loop
For Loop
Foreach Loop
 

Module 8: Methods in C#

Methods
Method Parameters
Pass by Value
Pass by Reference
Output Parameters
Variable Argument List
Method Overloading
 

Module 9: Arrays

1-D Arrays
2-D Arrays
Multidimensional Arrays
Jagged Arrays
System.Array Class
ArrayList Class
 

Module 10: Strings

Creating Strings
Common String Methods
Comparing Strings
Finding Substrings
Mutable Strings
Array of Strings
Equals vs ==
 

Module 11: Structs & Enums

Structs
Struct Methods
Struct vs Classes
Enums
Enum Initialization
Enum Type Conversion
 

Module 13: Error & Exceptions

Debugging
Types of Errors
Exceptions
Exception Properties
Exception Handling Syntax
Multiple Catch Statements
Exception Hierarchy
General Catch Handler
Finally Statement
Throwing Exceptions
Custom Exceptions
 

Module 14: Debugging

Debug Windows (Data Tips, Locals/Auto, Quick Watch, Watch, Call Stack, Immediate)
Breakpoints & Tracepoints
Glyphs
Adding, Deleting, Disabling, and Enabling Breakpoints
Breakpoint Filters
Breakpoint Condition
Breakpoint HitCount
Code Stepping (Step Into, Step Over, Step Out)
Edit Variable Value
Set the Next Statement
 

Module 15: Collections

Basic Collection Interfaces
Queue
IList Interface
ArrayList Class
IDictionary
StringDictionary
Types of Collections
 

4.Software testing

 

Module 1: Introduction to Software Testing

What is Software Testing?
Importance and Objectives of Software Testing
Role of Testing in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Co-Relation between Development and Testing Activities
 

Module 2: Testing Throughout the Development Cycle

SDLC Models
V Model
Testing Methodologies (V&V)
Testing Levels: Unit/Integration Testing, System/UAT Testing
Maintenance Testing
Functional vs Non-Functional Testing
 

Module 3: Static Testing

Introduction to Static Testing
Types of Static Testing
Walkthrough Process
Review Process
Work Products for Review
 

Module 4: White Box Testing Techniques

Statement Coverage
Condition Coverage
Decision Coverage
 

Module 5: Test Design Techniques

Identification of Test Scenarios and Test Conditions
Writing Effective Test Cases
Understanding Test Case Priority
Test Case Review
 

Module 6: Black Box Testing Techniques

Equivalence Class Partitioning
Boundary Value Analysis
Decision Tables
State Transition Testing
Use Case Testing
 

Module 7: Other Types of Testing

Error Guessing
Exploratory Testing
User Experience Testing
Performance Testing
Security Testing
Configuration and Compatibility Testing
 

Module 8: Test Management

Roles and Responsibilities of the Test Team
Test Planning
Contents of Test Plan Document
Test Strategy
Entry Criteria
Execution Cycle
Exit Criteria
Risk Analysis
Test Monitoring and Control
Test Closure Activities (Reports and Metrics)
 

Module 9: Defect Management

What is a Defect?
Defect Attributes
Defect Tracking
Defect Life Cycle
Defect Severity and Priority
Difference and Co-Relation between Test Case Priority and Defect Priority
 

Module 10: Tool Support for Testing

Types of Tools Used in Testing
Test Management Tools
Defect Tracking Tools
Test Automation Tools
Other Tools
Tool Selection Criteria
Success Factors for Tools
 

Module 11: Auto mutation

Selenium introduction
 

Module 12: Testing Methodologies

Spiral Methodology
XP (Extreme Programming) Methodology

9/15/23, 15:23 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear Students,

 

Greetings from FUEL!

 

Please find below test URL & login details.

 

Test URL - https://amcatcampus.aspiringminds.com/

 

Branch

username

password

BTECH

FUEL_129289_BTECH

amcat

 

Candidates can use our chat support with the below URL if they face any challenges during the test.

 

Chat Support - Click Here

 

Instructions:

 

Hardware and Internet requirements:

тАвA Personal Computer / Laptop. Please donтАЩt take the test from Mobile Browser.

тАвA Webcam connected with the System/In-built Webcam in a laptop.

тАвSmooth and uninterrupted Internet connectivity (throughout the testing session), minimum 1 MBPS/4G.

Browser/OS Requirements:

тАвThis Assessment is supported by the below-listed Browsers/Versions only.

тАвGoogle Chrome (version 40 and above)

тАвMozilla Firefox (version 40 and above)

тАвIn case you're taking the test on Windows 8, make sure you use the latest version and disable all the popups/ notifications.

DoтАЩs & DonтАЩt- Instructions:

тАвComplete the test in one go, no breaks allowed in-between.

тАвThis is a timed test; it is essential to keep track of time while answering the questions.

тАвAnswer all the questions and complete all the modules.

тАвThere is no negative marking.

тАвYou cannot change your answer to any previous question.

тАвDo not click on Module Exit or Test Exit.

тАвEnsure that while taking the test, no other tab/window/link is opened simultaneously on your system else your scores will not be processed.

тАвDo not try to take screenshots of the test, else your test will be locked & you wonтАЩt be able to complete the test.

тАвPlease disable all POP-UPS/ Notifications before starting the test.

тАвEnsure your face is clearly visible on the webcam. Do not wear a cap, scarf, goggles/ sunglasses, headphones, earphones, etc., or hide your face during the test.

тАвPlease ensure that no one else is sitting with you during the entire duration of the test.

Steps for starting the test:

тАвFor taking the exam type the URL in the address bar of the Web Browser.

тАвEnter the username and password given to you to login. Do not copy-paste the Username and Password. Always type in.

тАвClick on Start New Test.

тАвYou will be automatically prompted to тАШAllowтАЩ your Camera to be enabled, please тАШACCEPTтАЩ the request. This will prompt a message тАШYou Are Under Surveillance'. Your camera is now enabled.

тАвFill the registration form.

тАвClick on Start Test and keep a note of your AMCAT ID as mentioned on the top.

тАвTo answer a question, click on Confirm and then Next to submit your answer. Do not click on Module Exit or Test Exit.

тАвIf your test gets stuck at any point, there is a тАШResume Test' option that will enable you to restart the test at the same place where you got stuck. Please ensure that you Resume the Test within 2 hours of your test being stopped, otherwise your login will expire, and you wonтАЩt be able to complete the test.

9/18/23, 12:14 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Dear Student

We are thrilled to extend our heartfelt congratulations to you for being selected to participate in the prestigious Prepleaf Elite Program! This is a remarkable achievement, and we are excited to welcome you to this exclusive community of talented individuals from top universities across India.


 
The Prepleaf Elite Program is a unique 10-week online training program tailored to equip you with advanced technical skills. By joining this program, you will have the opportunity to study alongside some of the brightest minds in India, providing you with insights into the level of preparation and dedication that sets the standard in the tech industry.

Here are some of the program highlights that you can look forward to:

1. Comprehensive Tech Curriculum: Our program covers advanced topics such as Advanced Data Structures, Databases, System Design, OS, and Networking. You will gain in-depth knowledge in these critical areas.

2. Weekly Mock Interviews & Technical Tests: Challenge yourself with weekly assessments based on the playbook of top product-based companies. This will help you refine your interview skills and readiness.

3. On-Demand Placement Support: For those gearing up for campus placements, we offer on-demand support to assist you in landing your dream job with leading companies.

4. Special Industry-Level Sessions: Learn the art of crafting a compelling resume and understand the importance of maintaining a strong LinkedIn profile. These sessions are designed to enhance your professional image.

5. HR-Level Mock Interviews: Sharpen your HR interview skills, making you stand out during your job interviews.

6. Aptitude Test Preparation: Gain a competitive edge in placement processes with in-depth preparation and analysis of various aptitude test topics.

7. Lucrative Placement Opportunities: Access opportunities with companies offering a minimum CTC of 10 LPA and above.

Your selection for the Prepleaf Elite Program is a testament to your dedication and potential. This program will undoubtedly be a transformative experience, setting you on the path to success in the tech industry.

We are looking forward to embarking on this exciting journey with you and witnessing your growth and accomplishments. Stay tuned for further program details and instructions.

Once again, congratulations on this significant achievement. Your future in the tech world is poised for greatness!

9/29/23, 13:01 - Sameer Katekar Sir: Registration for Adroitec Engineering Solutions Pvt. Ltd. 2024 Batch Mech Branch Sinhgad Pandharpur only                                                                                                   Only Interested Students should fill this form. Need to register on or before 30th Sept. 2023 up to 10:00 a.m.

Internship Proposal: 3D Visualization Intern

Objective:
We are excited to invite motivated and talented students to apply for a 3-month internship opportunity in the field of 3D Visualization. This internship program offers a unique chance to work with cutting-edge software and gain hands-on experience in technical 3D visualization, using tools like Creo Illustrate, Arbortext, and Creo Parametric. As an intern, you will be an integral part of our dynamic team, contributing to real-world projects and enhancing your skills in a professional environment.

Company Overview:
Adroitec Engineering Solutions (P) Ltd is an ISO 9001 Certified Global Engineering Solutions provider with state-of-the-art development centers in India and a 100% owned US based subsidiary HOPE Consulting Inc.. With a team of over 300+ highly qualified and experienced professionals, Adroitec delivers services which are closely aligned with the design-through-manufacturing strategies of its global manufacturing customers, crashing cycle times and reducing costs.

Internship Details:
Type: Onsite / Work @ office
Position: 3D Visualization Intern
Duration: 3 months
Work Days: Monday to Friday + Last Saturday of the month
Work Hours: 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM
Location: Secunderabad
Batches
First Batch: September start to November end
Second Batch: December start to February end
Third Batch: March start to May end
Internship Responsibilities:
Utilize technical 3D visualization software, including Creo Illustrate, Arbortext, and Creo Parametric, to create accurate and visually appealing technical visualizations.
Collaborate with the team to understand project requirements and contribute innovative ideas to enhance visual representations.
Transform complex technical concepts into easily understandable visual content.
Contribute to the creation of 3D models, animations, and interactive content to support technical documentation.
Participate in team meetings, discussions, and training sessions to enhance skills and understanding of industry practices.

Internship Benefits:
Gain hands-on experience with industry-standard 3D visualization software.
Work closely with experienced professionals in the field, fostering mentorship and skill development.
Apply theoretical knowledge to real-world projects and build a strong portfolio.
Understand the workflow of technical documentation and 3D visualization in a professional setting.
High-performing candidates will be offered regular employment.

Requirements:
Currently pursuing a degree in Mechanical or related streams.
Strong interest in 3D visualization, computer graphics, or related areas.
Familiarity with 3D modeling concepts and software is a plus.
Excellent attention to detail and creativity in visual storytelling.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.
Application Process:
Interested candidates are requested to submit their resumes and a brief cover letter outlining their interest in the internship. Shortlisted candidates will be invited for an interview to further discuss their qualifications and aspirations.

Salary - first 03 months during internship salary Rs. 5000/- After completion internship salary will be Rs. 3.00 LPA   

Registration Link:- https://forms.gle/VDSgGWci5ivQ1AhCA

Steps to take the AI Proctored Assessment:

* Candidates are requested to download the HireMee Mobile App from Google
play/IOS app store. Or By using the below download link.

* Register yourself by entering Name, E Mail Id and Mobile Number.

* OTP will be sent to E-mail ID and mobile number for account validation

* Candidate will sign into the Mobile App for filling the profile
information (Personal and Educational details & video resume)

* Post updating the profile information, The candidates can start the test
by clicking on HireMee Assessment tab in the dashboard



Kindly read the below instructions carefully before taking assessment:

* Check the front camera before taking the assessment, It should be in a
working condition. Do not close/shut off the front camera manually once the
test begins.

* Make sure your mobile battery is fully charged before starting the
assessment.

* Active internet connectivity of minimum 1 MBPS is required for taking the
assessment. Make sure your internet is working. (preferably 3G,4G).

*This assessment will be on  October 10th(10.10.2023) after the registration
and assessment can be taken

* During the assessment candidate should make sure that only his/her face is
visible to the front camera from the test start to till the end.

* During the assessment apart from the candidate face, if any other person
face is captured, The system will consider this as a malpractice & candidate
ID will be blocked, Results will not be published for the particular
candidate.



Please find the PPT for your reference



Note:After the assessment students have to click on Submit Button to get the
result.



The assessment is a 100-minute proctored /artificial intelligent (AI
proctored) computer/App-based-test for graduating students at their premises
using HireMee proprietary assessment application that randomly draws
questions from its quarter million strong question bank to test

1.      Verbal Aptitude
2.      Quantitative Aptitude
3.      Logical Reasoning
4.      Technical Computer Fundamentals
5.      Behavioral Aptitude / Personality
6.      Communication

Core Domain knowledg

Kindly take a note that as the whole process is online and evaluation is managed through third party softwares, it will be difficult to adjust any slot change / re-test etc.

i.) Candidates need to check their emails for update and be available as per their assigned test-slots. Test links will expire after scheduled time.
ii.) Candidates should follow all the instructions emailed to them rigorously. Switching browsers while the test is ongoing for any reason, clicking anywhere other than within the exam window and such activities are not allowed and can cause the test to be cancelled.
iii.) Candidates should have a webcam installed and stable internet connection.
iv.) Please keep the candidates informed about the Round 1 and Round 2 timings. 
v.) Candidates need to check their spam folders to avoid missing updates about their test slots and links.
vi.) Candidates should open the examination link in incognito mode of web-browser to avoid cookies and cache related issues.

10/16/23, 13:39 - Sameer Katekar Sir: *Folks, campus drives from cpc pune are shared on the pod platform and CAMPUS drives from our college are shared on google form. Sometimes, the same company like worley, Schneider Electric etc are available on pod as well as google form. Its expected that, you must registered on both platforms, so that you will get two times opportunities to face the same company. But it is observed that, many are not registering on both platform. They are missing either pod or google form Registration. Due to this, they are missing one opportunity out of two opportunities for the same company.*
Hence be very active, dynamic and alert.
